wikipedia_page.main: Mary Margaret Cameron (9 March 1865 – 15 February 1921) was a Scottish artist, renowned for her depictions of everyday Spanish life. She exhibited 54 works at the Royal Scottish Academy between 1886 and 1919.

response: * Duncan Cameron, (1825–1901), owner of The Oban Times newspaper and inventor of The "Waverley" nib pen and his daughter, Mary Cameron (painter) (1865–1921)
*Mary Gilmore (1865–1962), née Mary Cameron, Australian socialist poet and journalist
*Mary Cameron (mother of David Cameron) (born 1934), mother of Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

link_mentions.page: List of painters by name beginning with "C"

response: Her father was Duncan Cameron, who was associated with the printing and stationery firm of Macniven and Cameron of Edinburgh, Scotland and the inventor of the "Waverley" pen nib.   Her mother was Mary Brown Small, a descendant of the Smalls of Dirnanean.  Flora's younger sister was Scottish painter Mary Cameron. Her father bought the Oban Times in 1882 and placed Flora's eldest brother as editor.
A younger daughter, Mary Cameron, was a Scottish portrait artist of some renown.
